body.name: A Love more Precious than Gold: A Historical Western Romance Novel
body.description: In a world where life has dealt her a tough hand, Ava Lawson, an eighteen-year-old orphan with a heart of gold, clings to her faith and her unwavering determination to protect the only family she has left - Leon, a sweet boy with a heartbreaking stutter. Together, they embark on a journey westward on the orphan train, in a desperate bid to secure a better life for Leon. Little did Ava know that fate had more in store for her when she stumbles upon an injured stranger in the woods, a man who possesses a life of privilege and emptiness; an encounter that will change her life foreverâ€¦Can Ava risk everything to protect the man who has touched her heart?Gabriel Miller, a spoiled young man from a life of luxury, finds himself thrust into a perilous journey to visit his uncle in California, accompanied by his loyal friend and assistant, Jericho. However, when their stagecoach is ambushed by ruthless bandits, Gabriel is left injured and alone in unfamiliar territory. It's in the care of Ava, a woman whose strength and selflessness captivate him, that he begins to question his own values. Yet as danger follows him he must navigate a treacherous path, not only to save himself but to shield the woman who has come to mean everything to him.Can she be the one to fill the void of emptiness he has always felt?As danger lurks at every corner, Ava and Gabriel, despite their differences and the threats that loom, find themselves drawn together by an unbreakable bond. Will they have the strength to overcome the perils that surround them or will their love story crumble under the weight of the challenges coming ahead?"A Love more Precious than Gold" is a historical romance novel of approximately 80,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helping leads to more
reviews.reviewText: She was sent to an orphanage when her mother died and now is 18 and needs to leave. But she volunteered to take some children out west to live. He’s going to California and is on a stage when it’s attacked and they want to take him hostage and ask for a ransom as he’s wealthy. But he’s injured and the young woman comes across him and offers her help. This leads to them becoming closer but how close? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ada is age 18 when being forced out of orphanage, instead decided to take orphans’ train west to accompany her 9 year-old friend, Leon, to assure he was placed in a good family. That did not happen, so Ada decided to adopt him herself at the last town. At the time Headmistress Anna statement to Ava “You were always destined to do something special, I could feel it.” Ada continued to do something special.Gabriel (Gabe) and his friend, Jericho were attacked on stagecoach. Criminal gang wanted to hold Gabe for ransom first from his rich parents, later his rich uncle. Shootout with Jericho injured, Gabe escaped to be injured. Ava found Gabe injured in woods outside the cabin. Ava did not trust the new town or Gabe, but her compassion would not let Gabe die in the woods. Gabe began to tell her of the events leading to his injury. Romance begins during recuperation, but need to figure out what happened to Jericho?Lots of events to keep this a page turner for the reader, including kidnapping, gun shootings, corrupt sheriff, and gang of criminals. Need to read story for all the details.Forecast for Ava did turn out when she and Gabriel opened their hearts and home to other orphans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heart of an orphan for an orphan
reviews.reviewText: Ava is now 18 years old and is of age to be sent from the orphanage where she has lived since her mother died, then her father found out he was ill and had to find someone to care for her. She asks to go on the orphan train to accompany the children, and she will stay out West where they will be taken. There is one boy, Leon, that she has bonded with. He has a stuttering problem, and everyone teases him terribly. Gabriel is very wealthy, and on a journey to visit his uncle in California, is targeted on a stagecoach, where bandits attempt to kidnap him for ransom. His best friend and paid companion, Jericho, helps Gabriel escape, and he ends up wounded in the woods. Ava finds him and helps him recover. This is their story. It is quite the story! Lots of action, danger everywhere, as Gabe and Ava try to uncover the truth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed and tells how some orphans were treated and dad to say but some still are. Hope you enjoy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely Good Book
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved this book. I would have given it a rating of 5 except for the fact that it had so many writing errors in it. Those did not keep me from thoroughly enjoying this book. Carol Colyer always writes a good tale, and this is one of her finest. The only thing that bothered me was in the extended story. The names of Mathew and Wes were changed. We did not find out what Jericho was doing or how Gabriel's parents were accepting Ava as their new daughter-in-law and if they had met her yet. The name of the head of the orphanage was also changed. This shows poor editing for not catching these errors. Overall though the book was wonderful to read, and I highly recommend it to everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful love adventure
reviews.reviewText: Ava had struggled a lot to take care of Leon a stuttering child. Gabriel and his friend Jericho were attacked by bandits on the way to Golden Pines to stay for a period with his uncle there. Bandits knew Gabriel is coming from a fortuned family and they want to kidnap him for ransom. Gabriel escaped to the wood. Eva and Leon found him and both carried him to the cabin. He implored her not to let anybody comes to know about him or his name. he promised her to pay her some money. Gabriel fall in love with Ava who rescued him and helped him come over his ordeal.The story is an interesting adventure that brought together two strangers together with their families and siblings into a lovely family.Wonderful and lovely story

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ava overcame odds since she was raised in an orphanage but had a big heart for those in her situation. She recognized that someone was adopting boys for the wrong reasons and saved one of the three by adopting him herself although she didn’t have a job yet.She started to make a family for the two of them until they found Gabriel wounded and helped him. His background was extremely different from hers (my only disappoint with the story was nothing was ever said about how his family dealt with/and or communicated with them as the story is resolved). There are many twists and characters are not what you might expect. Both Ava and Gabriel are very loyal to those that are their friends. Well worth the read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ava was an orphan who needed to find her way in the world. She took the orphan train west to place some children. Leon had been in the orphanage for years and was very attached to Ava. When no one took him she adopted him. Two young boys, Wes and Mathew, were adopted by an abusive man and when Ava found out, she made it her job to save them. Gabriel was traveling to his uncles when his coach was attacked. Ava found him lying in the woods and took him home. It’s a good story about survival and finding love. The negative side to this story is the epilogue. What happened to Jericho? Why did Wes and Mathew have different names, unless they are different children? Nothing had closure.
